climatePledgeFriendly.details: EWG Verified products are reviewed to ensure they are free from EWG’s known chemicals of concern and adhere to strict health standards.

features: Medicated diaper rash ointment: Triple Paste is the pediatrician-recommended diaper rash ointment with an all-in-one triple action formula that treats mild to severe rashes, immediately soothes baby’s bum and prevents future diaper rashes

Gentle yet effective formula: The Triple Paste formula leverages the healing properties of 12.8% non-nano zinc oxide and combines them with nourishing oat extract and protective beeswax and more to immediately soothe and treat irritated skin

Better for baby: The diaper rash ointment is free from fragrance, alcohol, talc, dyes, parabens, phthalates and preservatives, making it gentle enough for daily use and safe for even the most sensitive skin
Forms a protective barrier: The ointment’s thick consistency provides fast-acting relief for existing irritation while preventing future diaper rashes
Triple Paste is celebrated by parents who simply want the best for their baby’s delicate skin; store in your baby's diaper bag for on-the-go ease with other baby essentials; packaging may vary
body.description: Smooth on lasting relief for diaper rash with Triple Paste Diaper Rash Cream. This gentle diaper rash ointment soothes, treats and prevents red, irritated skin caused by diaper rash without harsh chemicals or unnecessary ingredients. Talc-free, fragrance-free and paraben-free, this hypoallergenic skin ointment contains zinc oxide (12.8%) to protect skin with a long-lasting barrier cream that seals out moisture between diaper changes and promotes healing. This medicated cream skin protectant provides lasting relief from raw, irritated skin in a skin treatment safe for everyday use. Clean the area and apply Triple Paste diaper cream liberally. Recommended by pediatricians and tested by dermatologists, Triple Paste Diaper Rash Medicated Ointment is the premium choice to treat diaper rash and provide lasting comfort.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My go-to lifesaver
reviews.reviewText: This is the best diaper rash cream! We noticed the slightest amount of redness and it was basically gone after the first application!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Favorite diaper cream
reviews.reviewText: My daughter has not had a diaper rash since using this cream liberally every night. Recommend getting the spatula for easy application and clean up, otherwise it will require a bit of work cleaning your hands afterwards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Only Paste That Works For US.
reviews.reviewText: We've tried a bunch of them for our little guy, but for some reason triple paste is the one that works best. I didn't even know it existed until my mom got it for me. I think you have to try and see what works for your childs skin and ph or whatever- but this one works for our guy. We've tried A&D, all the butt stuff varieties, oatmeal, etc. for rashes. This is the one we get, one jar lasts us such a long time too- probably 6 months. Try the smaller one out before you buy this one cause this big jar is expensive but worth it if it works for your kid!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars much better than desitin
reviews.reviewText: i've used desitin preventatively with every diaper change since my daughter was born, but i feel like it just disappeared between changes, and she still developed diaper rash a few times anyway. then i actually read the ingredients and realized it has talc in it, which has been shown to cause reproductive cancers in females, so i stopped using it immediately and bought this as a talc-free alternative. i like this so much better, and i wish i had used this from the beginning. you can really feel and see the barrier this cream leaves on the skin, even between diaper changes. it's exponentially more expensive which is a huge downside, but we're fortunate that we can afford it, and i will be using this from now on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lives up to Pediatrician Recommendation
reviews.reviewText: Our newborn was getting a pretty bad rash from the constant diaper changes and this was recommended to us by our pediatrician. It’s great! We now keep it everywhere - diaper bag, daycare, nursery, change table. There is a size that comes with a pop top as opposed to the screw on lid which is much easier for diaper changes but still highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buy it! Seriously
reviews.reviewText: It’s currently 4:00am as I write this feeding my one month old. Now this is my third baby so I know they poop a lot, but this baby is a poop machine, plus for a cold from her sister (thanks daycare). My new baby is literally pooping ever diaper. So needless to say it’s hard for any cream to work when you’re constantly having to wipe her bottom. I read the reviews for this cream and decided to give it a chance, I recorded it yesterday and used right away, as of her last diaper change, the sores are looking so much better and just about gone, already!!! Idk what’s different about this stuff, but it works! I was using my go to purple Destin and it wasn’t seeming to help at all aside from maybe keeping it from getting worse. I used that with my other 2 kids and swore by it. This will be my go to from now on and I’ll continue to spread the word. Worth every penny!!! P

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This ointment is the best
reviews.reviewText: I have used it with both of my kids. Moreover, it is a good stuff for other kinds of irritative skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A BLESSING TO MUM'S/ DAD'S AND MOSTLY BABY'S BUMS!!!
reviews.reviewText: Listen! You want to read this comment.I have tried almost ALL diaper creams in the market, including the famous Arbonne. They either smell terrible, stain the baby's skin, don't fix the rash, or are too thick to spread...worse still, some of them are all these things combined. Anyway, in a desperate attempt to find ONE MORE THING TO TRY, I landed on this product. I was skeptical, but I opted to trust the reviews and try it. My baby was transitioning to solids, so she was having diaper rashes a lot, even though we changed her every hour.First, there is no smell (it's so faint that I don't even smell it!). 2nd, even with my finger, it slides on the skin like butter. 3rd, I used a wet wipe to wipe it off and noticed this cream didn't stain her skin. I wiped her clean with no residue left. Okay, now they got me! 4th, this changed my life as a mum and my baby's bum...her rash was gone, OVERNIGHT! No kidding! This company doesn't pay me anything to say this...but I didn't trust it the first time, too, until it happened repeatedly! The best part is that once the rashes are gone, her skin is healthy and doesn't leave scars.Fast forward, my daughter is two years old. I have NEVER looked back! I give this cream to all my mum friends, and now this is what parents get at their baby showers, lol. If you are still reading this review, add it to the cart already. I know...I know...just because it worked for me doesn't mean it will work for you; that's true! But what do you have to lose?P.S: If you are a parent like me who doesn't like cross-contamination...I bought those tiny disposable wooden ice cream scoops to use with every diaper change and discard. How much? I think it was 500 pieces for less than $10. You are welcome :)
El precio es elevado más sin embargo funciona perfectamente para quitar dermatitis en el bebé o cualquier alergia al pañal
